description: No description
Table that contains all jurisdiction records for existing and future data input

fields.description: Jurisdictions reviewed by AB. Useful to clarify to the user which jurisdictions have complete data.
This tab explains jurisdictional peculiarities such as the judicial hierarchy and allows user to get disclaimers before consulting jurisdictional information.
A jurisdictional record can be classified as "State", "Financial" (district), "Supraregional", "Regional" or "Federal" according to the legal nature of its rules.
Comprehensive regional classification according to the purposes of this research project. Asia & Pacific and South & Latin America are consolidated regions.

The Global North does not refer to a geographic region in any traditional sense but rather to the relative power and wealth of countries in distinct parts of the world. The Global North includes many countries in the Northern Hemisphere and also some, such as Australia and New Zealand, that are located in the Southern Hemisphere. The Global South includes many countries in the southern hemisphere and some in the northern hemisphere. (see L. Braff and K. Nelson, The Global North: Introducing the region, in Gendered Lives, State University of New York, 2022).

Cases decided by a State Courts

fields.description: Unique identifier consisting of the Alpha-3 country code and unique number for the case law decision

This field contains information on the Issuing Court, the Claimant and Respondent's names, the Number ID of the case, and the date when the decision was issued. The way the case is cited varies according to the jurisdiction.

Main part of the case citation (information identifying the case, be it the parties' names, the "case title", or how the case is commonly known by practitioners). Some jurisdictions might also use the number as a Case ID.
Evaluation of court decisions and assignment of a rank from 1-10 with 1 being completely unrelated/unimportant and 10 being of indispensable importance.
Questions answered by this case for the corresponding jurisdiction
Website where the case law decision is available
Official abstract of the decision translated into English (if possible), otherwise AI-generated
Full text of the case translated into English (if the original language of the decision is not English)
Internal field: Remarks related to the case law analysis and tied to the case ranking or nature of the case
Automated field pertaining to the Questions tab

A short summary of the facts of the case (who are the parties, what happened, what is the dispute about, the different stages of court proceedings, etc.). This field prioritizes information on choice of law.

The relevant legal provisions that are related to choice of law from the choice of law issue(s)/agreement/clause/interpretation(s). This field might also include important precedents or other decisions that were used as a reference in the judgment.
Questions arising from the choice of law issue(s)/agreement/clause/interpretation(s)
The opinion of the court in regard to the statements made in the "Choice of law issue" column.

fields.field: Text of the Relevant Legal Provisions
fields.description: Full text of the relevant rules involved. Also found in the "Answers" tab with further elaboration of the legal provision.
Excerpt of the decision where the court justifies its position (judgment). The quote is always in the original language of the case/in the words of the court.
English translation of the "Quote" column (relevant excerpt of the decision)
Questions corresponding to the Answers connected to this case (manually selected)
Internal field to indicate that the PDF file cannot be publicly shared
Arbitral award preceding this court decision (contested before this Court)
Automated helper column linked to the Jurisdictions tab
Automated helper column linked to the Jurisdictions tab
Date when the court decided the case. Might vary from publication date.
Official keywords indicated by the court, even if it goes beyond the PIL scope - if possible, translate them
